TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageView extends Android.Views.View

Docs.summary: Displays image resources, for example android.graphics.Bitmap or android.graphics.drawable.Drawable resources.

remarks.para: Displays image resources, for example android.graphics.Bitmap or android.graphics.drawable.Drawable resources. ImageView is also commonly used to apply tints to an image and handle image scaling.
The following XML snippet is a common example of using an ImageView to display an image resource:
To learn more about Drawables, see: Drawable Resources. To learn more about working with Bitmaps, see: Handling Bitmaps.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub AnimateTransform (matrix As Matrix)
public: virtual void AnimateTransform(Android::Graphics::Matrix ^ matrix);
public virtual void AnimateTransform (Android.Graphics.Matrix? matrix);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AnimateTransform(class Android.Graphics.Matrix matrix) cil managed
abstract member AnimateTransform : Android.Graphics.Matrix -> unit override this.AnimateTransform : Android.Graphics.Matrix -> unit

Docs.param: The transformation parameters in matrix form.
Docs.summary: Applies a temporary transformation Matrix to the view's drawable when it is drawn.

remarks.para:
Applies a temporary transformation Matrix to the view's drawable when it is drawn. Allows custom scaling, translation, and perspective distortion during an animation.
This method is a lightweight analogue of ImageView#setImageMatrix(Matrix) to use only during animations as this matrix will be cleared after the next drawable update or view's bounds change.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property ImageMatrix As Matrix
public: virtual property Android::Graphics::Matrix ^ ImageMatrix { Android::Graphics::Matrix ^ get(); void set(Android::Graphics::Matrix ^ value); };
public virtual Android.Graphics.Matrix? ImageMatrix { get; set; }
.property instance class Android.Graphics.Matrix ImageMatrix
member this.ImageMatrix : Android.Graphics.Matrix with get, set

Docs.param: The transformation parameters in matrix form.
Docs.summary: Returns the view's optional matrix. -or- Adds a transformation Matrix that is applied to the view's drawable when it is drawn.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:

Returns the view's optional matrix. This is applied to the view's drawable when it is drawn. If there is no matrix, this method will return an identity matrix. Do not change this matrix in place but make a copy. If you want a different matrix applied to the drawable, be sure to call setImageMatrix().
Property setter documentation:
Adds a transformation Matrix that is applied to the view's drawable when it is drawn. Allows custom scaling, translation, and perspective distortion.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.property instance class Android.Graphics.BlendMode ImageTintBlendMode
member this.ImageTintBlendMode : Android.Graphics.BlendMode with get, set

Docs.param: the blending mode used to apply the tint, may be null to clear tint
Docs.summary: Gets the blending mode used to apply the tint to the image Drawable -or- Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by #setImageTintList(ColorStateList)} to the image drawable.
Docs.value: the blending mode used to apply the tint to the image Drawable

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Gets the blending mode used to apply the tint to the image Drawable
Property setter documentation:
Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by #setImageTintList(ColorStateList)} to the image drawable. The default mode is BlendMode#SRC_IN.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property ImageTintList As ColorStateList
public: virtual property Android::Content::Res::ColorStateList ^ ImageTintList { Android::Content::Res::ColorStateList ^ get(); void set(Android::Content::Res::ColorStateList ^ value); };
public virtual Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList? ImageTintList { get; set; }
.property instance class Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList ImageTintList
member this.ImageTintList : Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList with get, set

Docs.param: the tint to apply, may be null to clear tint
Docs.summary: Get the current android.content.res.ColorStateList used to tint the image Drawable, or null if no tint is applied. -or- Applies a tint to the image drawable.
Docs.value: the tint applied to the image drawable

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Get the current android.content.res.ColorStateList used to tint the image Drawable, or null if no tint is applied.
Property setter documentation:
Applies a tint to the image drawable. Does not modify the current tint mode, which is PorterDuff.Mode#SRC_IN by default.
Subsequent calls to #setImageDrawable(Drawable) will automatically mutate the drawable and apply the specified tint and tint mode using Drawable#setTintList(ColorStateList).

Note: The default tint mode used by this setter is NOT consistent with the default tint mode used by the android.R.styleable#ImageView_tint android:tint attribute. If the android:tint attribute is specified, the default tint mode will be set to PorterDuff.Mode#SRC_ATOP to ensure consistency with earlier versions of the platform.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAdjustViewBounds(bool adjustViewBounds) cil managed
abstract member SetAdjustViewBounds : bool -> unit override this.SetAdjustViewBounds : bool -> unit

Docs.param: Whether to adjust the bounds of this view to preserve the original aspect ratio of the drawable.
Docs.summary: Set this to true if you want the ImageView to adjust its bounds to preserve the aspect ratio of its drawable.

remarks.para: Set this to true if you want the ImageView to adjust its bounds to preserve the aspect ratio of its drawable.

Note: If the application targets API level 17 or lower, adjustViewBounds will allow the drawable to shrink the view bounds, but not grow to fill available measured space in all cases. This is for compatibility with legacy android.view.View.MeasureSpec MeasureSpec and android.widget.RelativeLayout RelativeLayout behavior.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub SetImageIcon (icon As Icon)
public: virtual void SetImageIcon(Android::Graphics::Drawables::Icon ^ icon);
public virtual void SetImageIcon (Android.Graphics.Drawables.Icon? icon);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetImageIcon(class Android.Graphics.Drawables.Icon icon) cil managed
abstract member SetImageIcon : Android.Graphics.Drawables.Icon -> unit override this.SetImageIcon : Android.Graphics.Drawables.Icon -> unit

Docs.param: an Icon holding the desired image, or null to clear the content
Docs.summary: Sets the content of this ImageView to the specified Icon.

remarks.para:
Sets the content of this ImageView to the specified Icon.

Depending on the Icon type, this may do Bitmap reading and decoding on the UI thread, which can cause UI jank. If that's a concern, consider using Icon#loadDrawableAsync(Context, Icon.OnDrawableLoadedListener, Handler) and then #setImageDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) instead.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

This does Bitmap reading and decoding on the UI thread, which can cause a latency hiccup. If that's a concern, consider using #setImageDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) or #setImageBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap) and android.graphics.BitmapFactory instead.

if true, merges the state values for the state you specify into the current state
Docs.summary: Set the state of the current android.graphics.drawable.StateListDrawable.

remarks.para: Set the state of the current android.graphics.drawable.StateListDrawable. For more information about State List Drawables, see: the Drawable Resource Guide.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub SetImageURI (uri As Uri)
public: virtual void SetImageURI(Android::Net::Uri ^ uri);
public virtual void SetImageURI (Android.Net.Uri? uri);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetImageURI(class Android.Net.Uri uri) cil managed
abstract member SetImageURI : Android.Net.Uri -> unit override this.SetImageURI : Android.Net.Uri -> unit

Docs.param: the Uri of an image, or null to clear the content
Docs.summary: Sets the content of this ImageView to the specified Uri.

remarks.para:
Sets the content of this ImageView to the specified Uri. Note that you use this method to load images from a local Uri only.

To learn how to display images from a remote Uri see: Handling Bitmaps

This does Bitmap reading and decoding on the UI thread, which can cause a latency hiccup. If that's a concern, consider using #setImageDrawable(Drawable) or #setImageBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap) and android.graphics.BitmapFactory instead.

On devices running SDK < 24, this method will fail to apply correct density scaling to images loaded from ContentResolver#SCHEME_CONTENT content and ContentResolver#SCHEME_FILE file schemes. Applications running on devices with SDK >= 24 MUST specify the targetSdkVersion in their manifest as 24 or above for density scaling to be applied to images loaded from these schemes.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub SetMaxHeight (maxHeight As Integer)
public: virtual void SetMaxHeight(int maxHeight);
public virtual void SetMaxHeight (int maxHeight);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetMaxHeight(int32 maxHeight) cil managed
abstract member SetMaxHeight : int -> unit override this.SetMaxHeight : int -> unit

Docs.param: maximum height for this view
Docs.summary: An optional argument to supply a maximum height for this view.

remarks.para: An optional argument to supply a maximum height for this view. Only valid if #setAdjustViewBounds(boolean) has been set to true. To set an image to be a maximum of 100 x 100 while preserving the original aspect ratio, do the following: 1) set adjustViewBounds to true 2) set maxWidth and maxHeight to 100 3) set the height and width layout params to WRAP_CONTENT.

Note that this view could be still smaller than 100 x 100 using this approach if the original image is small. To set an image to a fixed size, specify that size in the layout params and then use #setScaleType(android.widget.ImageView.ScaleType) to determine how to fit the image within the bounds.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: An optional argument to supply a maximum width for this view. Only valid if #setAdjustViewBounds(boolean) has been set to true. To set an image to be a maximum of 100 x 100 while preserving the original aspect ratio, do the following: 1) set adjustViewBounds to true 2) set maxWidth and maxHeight to 100 3) set the height and width layout params to WRAP_CONTENT.

Note that this view could be still smaller than 100 x 100 using this approach if the original image is small. To set an image to a fixed size, specify that size in the layout params and then use #setScaleType(android.widget.ImageView.ScaleType) to determine how to fit the image within the bounds.
